def.dt: :a vehicle (as a railroad coach or an automobile) that moves on wheels
:the part of a balloon or an airship in which passengers or equipment are carried

entry.et:
Medieval French
carre,from Latin
carrus,of Celtic origin

def.dt: :a portable seat for an infant or a small child that attaches to an automobile seat and holds the child safely
:a small electric car made to be driven around in an enclosure and to be bumped into others (as in an amusement park)
:a car moved on a railway by an endless cable or along an overhead cableway
:a railroad car in which meals are served
:a railroad passenger car with seats for lounging and facilities for serving refreshments
:an extra-fare railroad passenger car equipped with individual chairs and formerly used for day travel
:an automobile (as a police car) equipped with two-way radio communications
